Sentence.sentence: Students use forums to chat, play games, and solve problems together at no cost, or they can pay a few hundred dollars to take courses with trained teachers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: About 100,000 students around the country participate in the program's competition series, which culminates in a national game-show-style contest held each May.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: There are both good and bad players in the eco-labeling game.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To reduce or avoid it, researchers have examined the effect of smoking, diet, brain-challenging games, exercise and other strategies.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The research stations on King George lsland offer a glimpse into the long game on this ice-blanketed continent as nations assert themselves, eroding the sway long held by countries like the United States, Britain, Australia and New Zealand.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Now, she attributes much of her understanding of college to that: But once I got to campus, it was a completely different ball game that no one really prepared me for.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: He had also planned the content of his speech to focus on the teams with the best records, the ones that had won the most games in the last season.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Sure, but there is a lot of traffic everywhere today because of the football game.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The speakers will watch the game together.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "And yet that happens every day in the video game world," Farley told reporters during a press conference Friday. "I was a main character in Fallout 4, a character by the name of Kellogg, and I never knew that I was doing vocal recording for that game thr
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In his latest experiment, published online in August, Steinberg and his colleagues used a computerized version of a card game called the Iowa Gambling Task to investigate how the presence of peers affects the way young people gather and apply information.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Now, she attributes much of her understanding of college to that: "But once I got to campus, it was a completely different ball game that no one really prepared me for."
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: So in my view, some creative thinking needs to come in here to find ways to help companies in this situation to stay ahead in the game, but at the same time, to remain technologically competitive.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: So the voice actors are pushing for the idea of secondary compensation一a performance bonus every time a game sells 2 million copies or downloads, or reaches 2 million subscribers, with a cap at 8 million.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Some "expert amateurs" in the satellite game could provide some inspiration for how to proceed responsibly.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Subjects played a computerized driving game in which the player must avoid crashing into a wall that materializes, without warning, on the roadway.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The board game Go(围棋) took over from chess as a new test for human thinking in 2016, when a computer beat one of the world's leading professional Go players.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: They have to give so much thought and attention to the low-level mechanics of handling the ball, or fingering the keys or reading the music, that they are unable to give any thought to the thing that matters—the game, or the music, respectively.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: They scanned the brains of teens and adults who were playing a virtual driving game designed to test whether players would brake at a yellow light or speed on through the crossroad.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"体育运动"之意。
means: athletics ：集合名词，常指需要体力与技术的sports与games，特指跳高、跑等竞技项目。
sport ：含义比athletics广泛，指各种形式的体育运动，尤指户外的如游泳、钓鱼、划船、登山等运动。
game ：主要指决定胜负的游戏、比赛，通常有一定的规则，参加者必须遵守，如蓝球、足球等。也作"运动会"解。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"比赛"之意。
means: game ： 指决定胜负的比赛，多以个人对抗或集体对抗形式根据一定的规则进行。
match ： 多指重要的，参加队数较多的大型比赛。

list.explanation: 适于嘲笑、批评、攻击或迫害的对象

example.en: After what he said at the meeting tonight he's going to be a fair game for the press.
example.zh: 他在今晚的会议上发表了意见后，将会成为新闻界最合适的攻击对象。

example.en: He was a fair game for our jokes.
example.zh: 他当我们的取笑对象再合适不过了。

list.explanation: (为进行敲诈而设下的)美人计(俗称"仙人跳")，敲诈，勒索.讹诈

example.en: I've seen through your badger game. I won't be taken in.
example.zh: 我已经识破你们设下的美人计了。我不会上当的。

Sentence.sentence: A baby's play is nothing more than a game.

Sentence.sentence: I felt that it would be a victory for us even if we lost the game.

Sentence.sentence: It had game boards in different sizes.

Sentence.sentence: Maurice Ashley was kind and smart, a former graduate returning to teach, and this job was no game for him: he meant business.

Sentence.sentence: Over the years, the game had been produced using letters in different sizes and game boards in different colors.

Sentence.sentence: Then he typed in the name of the word game.

Sentence.sentence: Through the first two games, her team did not get one serious shot on goal.

Sentence.sentence: Turning one's life into a waiting game requires faith and hope, and is strictly for the optimists among us.

Sentence.sentence: When they showed up for their Sunday game, they were completely different.

Sentence.sentence: If we readjust our view of arguments—from a verbal fight or tennis game to a reasoned exchange through which we all gain mutual respect, and understanding—then we change the very nature of what it means to "win" an argument.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

sentences.en: They are playing a game of cards.
sentences.cn: 他们在玩牌。

sentences.en: The football game is yours.
sentences.cn: 这场足球赛你们胜了。

means.word_mean: 一场, 一局, 一盘

sentences.en: They have lost the first game.
sentences.cn: 他们已经输了第一局。

sentences.en: The top team in each group played off seven games against each other.
sentences.cn: 各组的前几名彼此进行七场比赛。

sentences.en: The 1984 Olympic Games was held in Los Angeles.
sentences.cn: 1984年奥林匹克运动会在洛杉矶举行。

sentences.en: The Asian Games meet every four years.
sentences.cn: 亚运会每四年举行一次。

sentences.en: Lions and tigers are big game.
sentences.cn: 狮子和老虎是大猎物。

means.word_mean: 比赛时用的手法；比赛技巧
勇敢的, 有决心的, 敢作敢当的

sentences.en: He was a game fighter even when he was losing.
sentences.cn: 即使当他失败的时候, 他也是一位勇敢的战士。

sentences.en: She is game for any risk.
sentences.cn: 她敢冒任何风险。

sentences.en: He is game for anything no matter how dangerous it is.
sentences.cn: 无论这件事有多么危险, 他都敢去做。

sentences.en: The little boy was hurt by the fall, but he was game enough to get up and try again.
sentences.cn: 这个小男孩跌倒受伤了, 但他非常勇敢地站起来, 准备再试一试。

means.word_mean: 愿意的, 心甘情愿的

sentences.en: “Who's game for a swim?”“I'm game!”
sentences.cn: “谁愿意去游泳?”“我愿意!”

sentences.en: The camel has a game leg.
sentences.cn: 那只骆驼有一只腿瘸。

sentences.en: He is game in the left leg.
sentences.cn: 他左腿瘸。</seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: ahead of one's competitors or peers in the same sphere of activity

phrase.cizu_name: beat someone at their own game

jx.jx_en_mean: use someone's own methods to outdo them in their chosen activity
jx.jx_cn_mean: 以其人之道还治其人之身

jx.jx_en_mean: the deception or crime is revealed or foiled
a signal for play to begin in a game or match
(informal, chiefly N. Amer.)said when a situation is regarded as hopeless or irreversible
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式， 主北美)没有希望的，无法挽回的

jx.jx_en_mean: the rivalry between Britain and Russia in central Asia during the 19th century
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大博弈（19世纪英俄两国在中亚地区的较量）

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)the best or most important of its kind; the only thing worth concerning oneself with
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)最好的；最重要的；最值得关心的

jx.jx_en_mean: advance another's plans, whether intentionally or not

lj.lj_ly: to what extent are they playing the government's game?.
lj.lj_ls: 他们支持政府会支持到什么程度？。

jx.jx_en_mean: behave in a fair or honourable way; abide by the rules or conventions
jx.jx_cn_mean: 办事公道，讲信誉；按章办事

jx.jx_en_mean: deal with someone or something in a way that lacks due seriousness or respect

entry.def: A game is an activity or sport usually involving skill, knowledge, or chance, in which you follow fixed rules and try to win against an opponent or to solve a puzzle.

example.ex: ...the wonderful game of football.
example.tran: 精彩的足球比赛

example.ex: ...a playful game of hide-and-seek.
example.tran: 有趣的捉迷藏游戏

entry.def: A game is one particular occasion on which a game is played.

example.ex: It was the first game of the season...
example.tran: 这是本赛季的首场比赛。

example.ex: He regularly watched our games from the stands...
example.tran: 他一般在看台上观看我们的比赛。

entry.def: A game is a part of a match, for example in tennis or bridge, consisting of a fixed number of points.
entry.tran: （网球、桥牌等比赛中的）一局，一盘，一场

example.ex: She won six games to love in the second set.
example.tran: 第二盘她以6比0获胜。

example.ex: ...the last three points of the second game.
example.tran: 第二局的最后3分

entry.def: Games are an organized event in which competitions in several sports take place.

example.ex: ...the 2000 Olympic Games at Sydney.
example.tran: 2000年悉尼奥运会

entry.def: Games are organized sports activities that children do at school.

example.ex: At his grammar school he is remembered for being bad at games but good in debates.
example.tran: 在文法学校里，他因拙于体育但擅长辩论而让人印象深刻。

entry.def: Someone's game is the degree of skill or the style that they use when playing a particular game.
entry.tran: （某人比赛或游戏时的）手法，技巧，风格

example.ex: Once I was through the first set my game picked up.
example.tran: 我打完第一局之后就进入了状态。

entry.def: You can describe a situation that you do not treat seriously as a game .
entry.tran: 玩笑；儿戏；不认真对待的事情

example.ex: Many people regard life as a game: you win some, you lose some...
example.tran: 许多人视人生如同一场游戏：有输也有赢。

example.ex: It's  a cat-and-mouse game to him, and I'm the mouse.
example.tran: 在他看来，这是个猫捉老鼠的把戏，而我就是老鼠。

entry.def: You can use game to describe a way of behaving in which a person uses a particular plan, usually in order to gain an advantage for himself or herself.

example.ex: When the uncertainties become greater than the certainties, we end up in a game of bluff...
example.tran: 情况愈发难以确定，我们最终陷入一个唬人的把戏中。

example.ex: Until now, the Americans have been playing a very delicate political game.
example.tran: 直到现在，美国人一直玩着精心设计的政治把戏。

entry.def: Wild animals or birds that are hunted for sport and sometimes cooked and eaten are referred to as game .

example.ex: ...men who shot game for food.
example.tran: 靠捕猎获取食物的人

entry.def: If you are game for something, you are willing to do something new, unusual, or risky.
entry.tran: 甘愿尝试（新鲜或不平常事物）的；有冒险精神的

example.ex: After all this time he still had new ideas and was game to try them...
example.tran: 过了这么久，他依然不乏新点子并敢于去尝试。

example.ex: He said he's game for a similar challenge next year.
example.tran: 他说他明年还愿意接受类似的挑战。

entry.def: If someone or something gives the game away, they reveal a secret or reveal their feelings, and this puts them at a disadvantage.

example.ex: The faces of the two conspirators gave the game away.
example.tran: 这两个共谋者的表情泄漏了秘密。

entry.def: If you are new to a particular game, you have not done a particular activity or been in a particular situation before.

example.ex: Don't  forget that she's new to this game and will take a while to complete the task.
example.tran: 别忘了她缺乏这方面的经验，完成任务还需要一些时间。

entry.def: If a man or woman is on the game, he or she is working as a prostitute.
If you beat someone at their own game, you use the same methods that they have used, but more successfully, so that you gain an advantage over them.
entry.tran: 将计就计；以其人之道还治其人之身

example.ex: He must anticipate the maneuvers of the other lawyers and beat them at their own game...
example.tran: 他必须预见到其他律师的策略，并以其人之道还治其人之身，从而打败他们。

example.ex: The police knew that to trap the killer they had to play him at his own game.
example.tran: 警方清楚他们必须将计就计才能逮住那个杀人凶手。

entry.def: If you say that something is all part of the game, you are telling someone not to be surprised or upset by something, because it is a normal part of the situation that they are in.
entry.tran: （某种情况下）常有的事，司空见惯的事

example.ex: For investors, risks are part of the game.
example.tran: 对投资者而言,风险不足为奇。

entry.def: If you say that someone is playing games or playing silly games, you mean that they are not treating a situation seriously and you are annoyed with them.
entry.tran: 不认真对待；耍花招；玩把戏

example.ex: 'Don't  play games with me!' he thundered...
example.tran: “别跟我耍把戏!”他怒吼道。

example.ex: From what I know of him he doesn't play silly games.
example.tran: 凭我对他的了解，他不会耍滑头的。

entry.def: If you say that someone has raised their game, you mean that they have begun to perform better, usually because they were under pressure to do so.
entry.tran: （通常在压力下）开始更好表现，干得更出色

example.ex: The world No. 9 had to raise his game to see off a strong challenge from Dale...
example.tran: 这位世界排名第九的选手必须有更出色的表现才能击退戴尔强有力的挑战。

example.ex: As it expands its services around the continent, the competition it offers should force the other airlines to raise their game.
example.tran: 这家航空公司在整个大陆拓展业务所带来的竞争会迫使其他航空公司有更好的表现。

entry.def: If you say the game is up, you mean that someone's secret plans or activities have been revealed and therefore must stop because they cannot succeed.
entry.tran: 戏该收场了，别再演戏了（指所从事的秘密计划或活动被揭穿）

example.ex: Some thought they would hold out until Sunday. The realists knew that the game was already up.
example.tran: 有些人以为他们还能撑到星期天，务实的人却很清楚，这一切都已结束了。

means.word_mean: 1. a single play of a game;
2. a contest with rules to determine a winner;

sentences.sentence: "you need four people to play this game"
"he thought of his painting as a game that filled his empty time"
"his life was all fun and games"

means.word_mean: 4. animal hunted for food or sport
5. the game equipment needed to play a game;

sentences.sentence: "the child received several games for his birthday"

means.word_mean: 6. your occupation or line of work;
7. (games) the score at a particular point or the score needed to win;
8. the flesh of wild animals that is used for food
9. a secret scheme to do something (especially something underhand or illegal);

sentences.sentence: "they concocted a plot to discredit the governor"
"I saw through his little game from the start"
"for actors, memorizing lines is no game"
"for him, life is all fun and games"

means.word_mean: 1. disabled in the feet or legs;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gamen 'amusement, fun', gamenian 'play, amuse oneself', of Germanic origin
late 18th cent.: originally dialect, of unknown origin

means: glucuronide triacetyl methyl ester 葡萄糖醛酸苷三酰基甲基酯
goat anti-murine IgE 山羊抗小鼠免疫球蛋白E

sentences.cn: 靠运气决定胜负 / 凭技巧取胜的游戏

sentences.cn: 学生们在论坛上免费地交流、玩游戏并合作解决问题，他们也可以花几百美元上受过培训的老师们的课。

sentences.cn: 越来越多的公司开始利用这种心理，直接创造了所谓的“游戏化”方法：从本质上说，就是把工作变成游戏。
sentences.en: Increasingly, companies are tapping into these desires directly through what has come to be known as “gamification”: essentially, turning work into a game.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 游戏化也可能意味着通过电子游戏平台来培训员工。
sentences.en: It could also mean training employees how to do their jobs through video game platforms.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 部分归功于电子游戏，现在这一代进入劳动力市场的人对于把自己的工作游戏化这个想法非常开放。
sentences.en: Thanks in part to video games, the generation now entering the workforce is especially open to the idea of having their work gamified.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: “在我们所生活的这个时代，很多发达地区的绝大多数年轻人都是玩着电子游戏长大的，并且有越来越多的成年人也在玩这些游戏。”Werbach 说。
sentences.en: “We are at a point where in much of the developed world the vast majority of young people grew up playing video games, and an increasingly high percentage of adults play these video games too,” Werbach says.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: “如果我们是为工程师设计，我压根不会提到‘游戏’这个词。”Cornetti 说。
sentences.en: “If we are designing for engineers, I’m not talking about a ‘game’ at all,” Cornetti says.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 然而，他说，“随着越来越多熟悉电子游戏的结构和表达形式的人进入劳动力市场”，游戏化只会变得越来越流行。
sentences.en: Still, gamification only stands to become more popular, he says, “as more and more people come into the workforce who are familiar with the structures and expressions of digital games.”
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第三套）| 阅读

Sentence.sentence: Was it because of the growing attraction of the Internet, video games and endless TV channels? Never disconnecting from work? No matter how it happened, millions of Americans are putting their health, quality of life and even length of life in danger.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Subjects who learned the games in the morning lost some skills when they played again 12 hours later.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: 200 college kids were taught to play some unfamiliar video games.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When turning work into a game, it is necessary to understand what makes games interesting.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: What makes a game game-like is that the player -108- actually cares about the outcome, Werbach says.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: We are at a point where in much of the developed world the vast majority of young people grew up playing video games, and an increasingly high percentage of adults play these video games too, Werbach says.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Video games contributed in some ways to the wide application of gamification.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Thanks in part to video games, the generation now entering the workforce is especially open to the idea of having their work gamified.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Still, gamification only stands to become more popular, he says, as more and more people come into the workforce who are familiar with the structures and expressions of digital games.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It could also mean training employees how to do their jobs through video game platforms.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Increasingly, companies are tapping into these desires directly through what has come to be known as gamification: essentially, turning work into a game.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Gamification is about understanding what it is that makes games engaging and what game designers do to create a great experience in games, and taking those learnings and applying them to other contexts such as the workplace and education, explains Kevin Werbach, a gamification expert who teaches at the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania in the United States.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For workers, especially low-paid workers, who desperately need their jobs yet know they can be easily replaced, gamification may feel more like the Hunger Games.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The objective of this debating game is not to win but to get to the truth that will allow you to move  faster, farther and better.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Internet gamers spend countless hours competing in games against people from all over the world.
